intro: Tragoceros mocinianus, commonly known as the Mocinian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
